data.title: BEST MEXICAN FOOD IN LAKE ELSINORE
data.text: This is a beautiful restaurant with excellent service and excellent food. It's nice to have a local restaurant impressive enough in decoration and food to take our out of town guest. It's a sit down, full service restaurant with a bar with many delicious margarita combinations. We will definitely be back. Top notch!

data.title: Diamond in the rough
data.text: You wouldn't know it but La Units is a small but superb eatery in downtown Lake Elsinore California.  Though small, the service is top notch and feels much more upscale.  The best part is that the food is just about perfect. Fresh, properly seasoned Mexican food, with authentic sauces I might add, have drawn me back multiple times. Week days you can get away with walking in but for Friday and Saturday evening, call ahead and make arrangements.  For holidays and other special occasions,the restaurant chef creates a special dish. And if you think of only tacos and enchiladas when you think of Mexican food, this place will substantially broaden your palate.  Don't confuse this place with La Unico, a much lesser quality place not far from La Unica. I highly recommend La Unica.

data.title: Great Tacos! Friendly Service.
data.text: The server was pleasant. My to go order was ready when I arrived. It was correct and the tacos were very good. I am looking forward to eating here again.

data.title: Girls date out.
data.text:
Love te place, The food is delicious.
I order chilaquiles  the people are very friendly.
The restaurant it's very clean.

data.title: Taco good. Relano undercooked
data.text: This was a second visit and the relanos we each had were way undercooked. The skin was very tough and was very hard to cut. Tacos were very good!

data.title: Tasty Mexican, No longer bakery
data.text: This is no longer a bakery, but has great Mexican Food.  Excellent burritos, chile colorado, sopes and flan.

data.title: Yummy baked goods
data.text: The first time I went here I was so impressed.  I really like baked goods so it was hard to choose between all the pastries.  I got a pastry and  a hot chocolate ( champurado )

data.title: Friendly and great food
data.text: Happy hour 3-7, and taco Tuesday's should be added to your lost of reasons to go here. Very good atmosphere and ferocious Mexican foods. No more bakery tho.

data.title: A 5 for sure!
data.text: We had heard about this restaurant from others and it was a gem. We had the chili relleno, a taco and a cheese enchilada. All tasted very good and the relleno was huge! So far this is the best Mexican place between Corona and Lake Elsinore. We will be back again!  $20 dinner for 2. Very affordable!

data.title: Best burritos in the valley
data.text: We have been going here for a long time. Even before the sons took over the bakery and turned it into the best Mexican place around. The calamari is outstanding and the burritos are great as is all the other offerings.  Great staff and the chef comes out to be sure everything is great.

data.title: Great Mexican Food!
data.text: This is a little place at a park that I overlooked for a long time.  Since my first visit I have been back numerous times.  They have great Mexican food!

data.title: Freindly lunch.
data.text: My friend and have starting stopping for lunch and dinner in Lake Elsinore ever since we ate at the El Unico restaurant, which is run by family members of La Unica. The food was hot, tasty and the service was friendly and make syou want to come there again.

data.title:
Awesome staff , awesome food and great 
Drinks
data.text:
Have been coming here for a little over a year. Great atmosphere
Their food and drink prices are reasonable we love coming on the weekends for breakfast, they are always accommodating to our big family . The waitresses are top notch and always remember you the next time you come.

data.title: a hidden culinary surprise
data.text: La Unica has a classically trained chef and a really energetic staff.  The food preparation, quality and presentation is unique.

data.title: Great service
data.text: Be prepared to wait if you come during prime time. The place is super small. The service is great and the drinks even better. I've only been once and we went to brunch. I had the unlimited mimosas and wasn't told they were an extra $10 charge, but I was okay with it because the champagne was great and I had at least $10 worth. Just have them fill your cup at the table because the one they prepared before bringing it to me was mainly orange juice. My food was great and had no other complaints in our group of 8 except my husband and a friend who said theirs were dry and flavorless. I would definitely try this place again.

data.title: Worth the Drive
data.text: My friend read about La Unica being the best Mexican food in Riverside County. I agree. Not only is the food great and the service great, the customers are fun and friendly!

data.title: Authentic Mexican food
data.text:
I brought my relatives from London here and ordered their wet burrito.  I never failed their expections.  It was their 1st time to eat a real Mexican food. The Mexican food that they had back in London was no comparison with the food in La Unica.  Just their salsa for their chips alone is a must,  it maybe too spicy for others but it's always perfect for me.
Just a tip, the place gets busy every weekend.  So, if you want to have a seat right away, you might want to arrive as early for dinner.

data.title: Unbelievable food and staff!
data.text: This is by far one of the best restaurants you could go to in the I.E. This restaurant is definitely a hidden jem!!! You won't be disappointed!

data.title: Great gem is the heart of historic Lake Elsinore
data.text: Great restaurant, service is top notch.  Food is traditional but adventurous. lf you like to explore great tasting mexican with a bit of their own twist, this is the place for you. Check out the specials, check out the menu, check out the drinks, this place is solid!

data.title: Wonderful dinner and drinks, attentive staff
data.text: We were looking for a local Mexican restaurant that was not a chain. Without the benefit of GPS with just happened upon La Unica. What a great little gem tucked away in this quiet little town. Our server was very friendly and made some helpful suggestions regarding cocktails (Blueberry Margarita-YUM!) and menu options. We hope our family and friends in the area will frequent this great place in the future.
